answers.answer: I feel your pain but its not people but my own monster myself. I see myself and walk around feeling like a cow. Today i cried so much i think i ak falling back to depression, BUT i am determined this time to be stronger.Stay positive mama

I think I gained a lot of weight too.. With my first baby I was at 95lbs before pregnancy and gained 60 lbs. This time I started at 110lbs and I'm already at 160lbs with a month to go. I know it ***** to have gained a bunch of weight :(. We have to be positive and be glad that we are able to carry children. Some women can't have kids and would give anything to be able to.

I am trying to be greatful.but if my husband didn't insist we would have adopted.. I always wanted to adopt.. still do.Anyway, it doesn't matter.It is what it is now.I just wish people could be more considerate and kinder.So with your weight gain..how did you find it going back into shape?Did it take long?
Don't get me wrong.I am so happy to have a baby.I just saw adoption as an option and he didn't.I still want us to adopt our second one.

I was pretty young when I had my first so I bounced back pretty quick. Didnt breast feed and didnt exercise. I hear breast feeding helps lose a lot of weight. This time around I highly doubt it'll be that easy so I plan on exercising, and I HATE doing that :/

I was 116lb (53kg) before I got pregnant.Now I am 163lb (74kg)..I want to be 116lb (53kg) again soon.I miss my wardrobe.. I have so pretty dresses!I miss sleeping on my belly.I miss wearing heels.I miss cocktails.I know things are going to change, but I just don't feel ready to give up my body/wardrobe..Even my boobs are bigger, and I kid you not, I prefer my smaller ones.
Well I was a c cup before then now I'm a DD... dont know how I feel about them yet. I do like my butt a little bigger, so does my husband lol.
Looks like we're not far off from the same weight gain although I dont have GD. I mentioned it to my dr because I thought I was gaining so much weight fast but he doesnt seem concerned

Mmmm I don't mind exercising..but I have doubt how well I will do when sleep is messed up and when my newborn requires a feed every 3rd hour..also I cant go on a diet as long as I breastfeed.I intend to stop breastfeeding after 3months.(and then start exercising and dieting)I just need to give myself a break, I can't breastfeed a year or even 6months..I desperately need to do some ME-time.It doesn't help that my husband is working out and getting superfit as we speak.. I am so jealous.

We were considering of adoption too.then now wth surprise baby #2 i am getting tube tie this Dec and hubby will have vasectomy just so we are sure no more babies.I know what you mean i love my babies too but it is our hormones messing our brains.. we arr happy but we are not used to this weight and rude people is not helping or for me the way i criticize myself.I wish we live in the same area and we can support each other.I still go to the gym at least 4x a week.Breastfeeding helped me lost 40lbs in 3months on my first pregnancy so that helps and just stay active.We can do this just remind yourself it took 9months to get all the extra weight so it will take about the same time to lose it.I was 110 before first pregnancy then after pregnancy i was 180!! I was on my way down back to normal weight I was 140 but this I got pregnant again. i am on 31week and I am at 170.Some people may think its not that big but I am am barely 5"2 and used to being 110 or 115.. so i am really not use to having extra weight.Just want to share that what you are feeling is normal as long as you know we got this and when baby is out make it our goal to go back to our healthy normal weight :)
Thank you hun. You've made me feel SO MUCH better!! <3 <3 <3
Lol you said it all the cocktail abd the wardrobe also being able to sleep on my stomach!! How old are you?Its like you read my mind what i was comolaining about

I know what you mean, I plan on going back to school after two months of my baby being born to finish my degree up. I dont know how I plan on fitting exercising in either. I think I get a little more jealous when I see my friends dress nice in heels and dresses and I'm feeling like a whale. I know I'll be all worth it once I hold my little princess in my arms

I am 6 weeks pregnant with my third child. I have type 1 diabetes. I have had it for 21 years now. It is muchore difficult to manage while pregnant. Taking it one day at a time and talking with others will definitely help ease your worries. Each woman has different body changes during their pregnancy. Do not let others judge you. It is up to your physician to determine if you are to large or not. Diabetes can increase the size of the baby, but it can also make their birth weight lower. It is important to take care of you and your baby's needs, so don't worry about all those other people and their comments, especially if they aren't your physician. Good luck.

anj3li3haha well.. I turned 30 not long ago actually.But I feel like 26 still.ncmitchIt is going to be really really HARD.No other way to put it.Delicia83I got my diabetes this pregnancy and my body REALLY changed. Weight-wise.It is a 1/3 chance I still have diabetes after birth.. I will find out.I truly hope I don't have it, because it is so much work with it..and I feel like it is stopping me to live like I want to live.My baby girl is only SLIGHTLY over the normal growth curve..her belly is a bit bigger but the rest looks great.All signs of diabetes appearntly.I just want it all to end.I want my baby girl and return to my pre-pregnancy eating habits.
How do you manage your diabetes while pregnant vs not pregnant?

I turned 31 this August and most of the time I forget my age I feel like 22.I am so glad I dont have GD i was worried actually because everyday i eat icecream, cake, cookies or chocolates as thats what I always crave for!!I was crying yesterday I thought I couldnt finish my day at work, my body feels like it is about to explode. It feels like its already stretched too much i can barely move, going to the gym has helped BUT it is still different I am not going to lie and say I LOVE the feeling of being pregnant. But I understand we are all different and some women are just better handling all the changes.I have OB appt today and asking my ob for anti dep prescription as i am falling again into depression, last pregnancy it got bad I was suicidal. This time I will kick post partum depression' @$$ before it start kicking mine lol!!And... i am actually looking forward to just get really angry about losing all these fatness after baby is out. I can understand the pregnancy belly but not the bloated face hands and legs lol.Cheers and good luck girl

I think we all hear it about our size from someone. I've gotten "you don't look pregnant are you sure the baby's okay?" Then I finally popped and I got "dang you got huge quick". Society just ***** and people feel like they have to add on their 2 sense on what they believe a woman should look like while pregnant. If your doctor says your doing fine. You are doing fine. People carry their babies all different ways and their body reacts to pregnancy way different then the next person. Alot of people don't understand that. As far as diabetes goes. I was diabetic before pregnancy so since I was 6 weeks pregnant I had to watch what I eat, write down everything, give myself insulin, walk even more closely. It's a pain in the ***. BUT, it will be very worth it when the baby is here. Knowing you took every precaution for a healthy baby. So eff what everyone else thinks. I know you are putting in all your effort. Congrats! And I hope baby comes soon :)

question: Hi girls,I'm 33w +3days & I have Gestational Diabetes.I'm keeping a record of my food intake and bloodsugar levels and all my insulin dosages.Carefully planning all my meals.It feels like every day is about this and that normal life is so complicated now.Due to my Diabetes I am growing larger than usual pregnancies (even with all my efforts) and the colleagues at work are not holding back their comments.It both hurts and annoys me.I used to be a skinny girl and now I am not.One colleague said I had exploaded..yes, actually used that word.Exploaded.another keeps going on and on about how big I am and how his friend who is closer to her due date is so much smaller.I find myself avoiding people at work.I avoid eyecontact.I try to get away and hide under bulky clothes.But EVERY DAY -without fail- people comment on my size and pregnancy.It truly bothers me.I have grown so self-aware and unhappy with my situation/appearance that I find it hard to enjoy the pregnancy and even at times having a baby.I constantly worry about my size/weight and I feel anxiety to have so many weeks left of my pregnancy.I just want to get back in shape.I don't go on maternity leave until 2weeks from now..No real question.Only complaining.:(
title: unhappy
